title: Funnydruids
author: Funnydruids
content: Anyone know where I can buy Monero safe and fast?

comments.author: Jawhead999
comments.body: You can't have an option of both safe and fast since different exchanges have their own advantages and disadvantages.The most safest to buy Monero is using decentralized exchanges, but lack of liquidity e.g. Bisq.The most fast to buy Monero is using popular centralized exchanges, but lack of privacy since they record your IP, email etc and foremost collect your KYC e.g. Binance, Kucoin, FTX.

comments.author: Quidat
comments.body: Just to add up some links on  markets or platforms where XMR is listed.https://coinmarketcap.com/currencies/monero/markets/But i do agree on what been said above.Expect those KYC and verifications before you could able to do so.If you want to have that full anonymity then DEX would be the key which had already been pointed above on where.

comments.author: vv181
comments.body: In case you didn't want to deal with KYC, you can take a look around: https://kycnot.me/?xmr=on to see which services suit you. And if you also have BTC, you might want to consider using the Monero atomic swap.

comments.author: shinratensei_
comments.body: Kucoin seems become the best place to buy your monero. I meant this exchange site is good exchange site. You didn't even need to do KYC to get a huge daily withdrawal limit. That means if your privacy can't be known by others even the exchange site itself. This is the best place for you to get your monero rather than another exchange site like binance which has been forcing all of its member to verify their identity

This is the best place for you to get your monero rather than another exchange site like binance which has been forcing all of its member to verify their identityAs I have been mentioned above, KuCoin still can record your IP address, email, password, real name etc. You may say you could create an account with random names, but the you will against their TOS if they will ask your KYC. Many people do often use same email and password for their personal and exchanges, this will leak your privacy. More over the IP address, they will know your location, you can't use Tor to access KuCoin.

comments.author: DireWolfM14
comments.body: Quote from: Bitcoin_Arena on September 11, 2022, 11:28:47 PMQuote from: Funnydruids on September 10, 2022, 07:30:38 PMI did trade total around 180 USD.Still not worth the risk. Avoid Changenow as it's one of those controversial services that has complaints when it comes to freezing funds.Use exchanges that are listed on Kycnot.me like Bisq, Elude, Majestic Bank etcFunny thing is that ChangeNow is listed on Kycnot.me with a score of 7/10, but then they say this about ChangNow's KYC policy:Quote from: https://kycnot.me/exchange/changenowChangeNOW is a non-custodial crypto-to-crypto exchange where you can trade a large number of coins quickly, conveniently, registration-free, and without any limits. Although it normally does not require KYC it could be that one of your transactions is marked as suspicious and then they will require you a KYC procedure. The suspicious transaction detection system is not public so we can't know what may trigger this. You can get a refund to your address if you don't want to provide your information (without KYC).As for some of ChangeNow's "scam accusations" I suspect they largely stem from their use of blockchain analysis to blacklist UTXOs.  It's really quite odd that exchanges will pay for a service that only results in alienating their customer base. It's worth noting that the only exchange listed with a perfect score (10/10) is Bisq.  Not surprising, due to the way bisq works it's quite likely the safest p2p exchange in existence.
